event.title: 1881 the Missouri, Kansas and Texas Railroad Company extended

data.event: In 1881 the Missouri, Kansas and Texas Railroad Company extended its line from Greenville to McKinney, passing through land owned by the brothers.
This name was accepted, and a post office was established in 1888.

event.title: 1940, a camp of 76 cabins was built

data.event: In 1940, a camp of 76 cabins was built west of Princeton to house up to 400 migrant workers, who came to work during the onion and cotton seasons.
In February 1945, the site became a prisoner-of-war camp for Germans prisoners captured during the Second World War.
This operation continued for eight months.
